description: &quot;Identity-Breach-IR guides incident responders through a Microsoft Sentinel investigation of an identity compromise, utilizing KQL and Sentinel logs to detect attacker tactics, uncover MITM session hijacking, and analyze post-login persistence and external access attempts in real time.&quot;

An academic article exploring the transformative applications of AIML in modern Cyber Security. The paper analyzes how AI is shifting defense strategies from reactive signature-based detection to proactive behavioral anomaly analysis, focusing on key areas like zero-day threat detection, automated vulnerability management, etc

This project focuses on enhancing the security and reliability of open-source software by leveraging fuzz testing (fuzzing) ‚Äî an automated technique that generates and injects malformed or random inputs into programs to uncover hidden vulnerabilities such as buffer overflows, memory leaks, and crashes.

This project is a practical cybersecurity demonstration that explores session management vulnerabilities in modern web applications. Built using Flask and gRPC, it provides a hands-on learning experience for understanding how session fixation attacks work and why secure session handling is critical.

HWID spoofer tools like spoofer EAC and easyanticheat bypass change hardware identifiers to avoid bans in games like Rust, Valorant, and Apex Legends. Drivers and cleaners ensure system compatibility and remove traces.

Hogwarts Gateway ‚Äî A Python-based HTTP server with an integrated Web Application Firewall (WAF). Blocks XSS, SQL Injection, OS Command Injection, Path Traversal, and dozens of other attack vectors. Fully configurable, high-security, and lightweight.

Gh0stlink exploit analysis (web service version): perform a controlled red-team style assessment of host vulnerable system, chain together discovered vulnerabilities, and achieve root access on the target machine, demonstrating reconnaissance, credential discovery, service pivoting, and privilege escalation
A two-layer NIDS that uses an ML-powered Flask API for real-time detection and a honeypot for capturing zero-day exploits to continuously retrain the model.

CVE-2025-59287 ‚Äî Critical unauthenticated RCE in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) via unsafe deserialization of an AuthorizationCookie, enabling SYSTEM-level compromise and active exploitation; patch or isolate WSUS (ports 8530/8531) immediately.

Modular Python framework for dynamic node health scoring and probabilistic fault injection in fog networks. Models fog node integrity in smart agriculture using real-time metrics, EMA thresholding, and health classification. Features fault injection, adaptive scoring, simulation control, and live visualisation. Exports logs in JSON/CSV for analysis

CVE-2025-59287 is a critical RCE vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) caused by unsafe deserialization of untrusted data. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code without authentication. Urgent patching is advised due to active exploitation.

Conducted a comprehensive vulnerability assessment of CyberTech Solutions‚Äô Linux and Nginx infrastructure using Nessus and Ansible. Identified and remediated critical DoS and RCE vulnerabilities, automated patching, and implemented continuous monitoring for improved security resilience.

Educational lab artifacts and analysis notes on stack-based memory corruption and mitigation behavior ‚Äî for defensive research &amp; SOC training (lab-only).

An AI-driven WordPress tool that analyzes soil health data, estimates financial returns from better farming practices, and generates PDF/CSV ROI reports. Built with modular architecture, clean UI patterns, and integrated documentation injection for seamless future updates.

Detects buffer overruns and memory leaks.

A static analysis framework that detects unsafe code patterns in Rust programs by combining LLVM-IR analysis with Neo4j graph databases. Identifies critical vulnerabilities like use-after-free, out-of-bounds access, and data races in unsafe Rust code blocks through efficient parsing, visualization, and optimized Cypher queries.

Ledger Firmware Spoofer - hardware wallet security research tool for firmware analysis and vulnerability testing. Study hardware security modules and secure element protocols in controlled environments.

The Simple User Registration plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Privilege Escalation in all versions up to, and including, 6.3. This is due to insufficient restrictions on user meta values that can be supplied during registration. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to register as an administrator.

Machine-learning tool that predicts whether a newly discovered software vulnerability will be exploited before a patch is available.
Python-based Web Application Vulnerability Scanner with CLI and Flask UI. Detects common vulnerabilities like XSS, SQLi, Directory Traversal, and generates structured reports.

This repository contains all the XSS cheatsheet data to allow contributions from the community.

This the meta package for Pacemaker Community, a Symfony based CLI application that provides import functionality for products, categories, attributes, and attribute-sets. The default format is CSV, adapters for XML are also available. The application can be declaratively extended by additional operations, which can be used to reassemble and execute the existing functionalities according to project-specific requirements. But also completely new commands can be integrated quickly and easily via dependency injection.

Auth Mutator is a Burp Suite extension that helps you experiment with mutated authentication requests while keeping the original traffic intact. It applies user-defined replace rules, removes authentication artefacts for unauthenticated probes, and highlights noteworthy responses so you can quickly spot interesting behaviour.
This repository provides a Proof of Concept for CVE-2023-45612, demonstrating an XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability in JetBrains Ktor versions prior to 2.3.5.

RAT tools use shellcodes for remote access and system control. Shellcode injection and execution techniques bypass defenses, while red team tools focus on compiling and handling payloads for post-exploitation scenarios.

This repo contains OpenCV code for analyzing the color of droplets imaged by an Atrandi Onyx after picoinjection with a dye. The repo also contains R code to parse csv outputs from the Onyx, and a design-of-experiments Excel CSV, to associate injection settings with outcomes.

In this course, master Hydra cybersecurity attack techniques through hands-on labs covering session restoration, SSL attacks, brute-force, and multi-target attacks.

In this course, you will learn about the most common web vulnerabilities and how to exploit them. You will learn about SQL Injection, File Inclusion, Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), File Upload, Command Injection, and Directory Traversal vulnerabilities. You will also learn how to exploit these vulnerabilities using various techniques and tools.

Poc for a critical vulnerability in Oracle Fusion Middleware Identity Manager's REST WebServices component affects versions 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.2.1.0. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to completely compromise the Identity Manager system.

Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.35 ‚Äì 2.4.63 are vulnerable to a client certificate authentication bypass when TLS 1.3 session resumption is used across virtual hosts with different `SSLCACertificateFile` directives.

Monitors and tests HTTP POST endpoints for insecure handling of user input. Detects missing validation, exposed headers, sensitive data leaks, and improper content-type use. Generates detailed JSON logs and recommendations to strengthen web API security. For ethical and authorized analysis.

This engagement simulated an external black-box penetration test against Cap.htb, resulting in full system compromise. The attack chain exploited misconfigured services and weak credential hygiene to escalate from unauthenticated access to root privileges.

Crawls a website and tests for reflected XSS and common SQL injection error patterns. Extracts same-host links, injects safe payloads into parameters, and produces JSON/CSV reports with findings and remediation notes for authorized security testing.

Hands-on DOM-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) walkthrough using DVWA. Demonstrates how insecure client-side code (location.hash/referrer, innerHTML, etc.) leads to JS execution and cookie exposure. Includes reproducible payloads, screenshots, Burp traces, and remediation steps using DOMPurify, CSP, and safe DOM APIs

This is an educational Django application designed to safely demonstrate common Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities ‚Äî including reflected, stored, and DOM-based XSS. The app intentionally bypasses Django‚Äôs built-in security protections (like auto-escaping) to show how unsafe handling of user input can lead to client-side script injection.

A session hijacking attack refers to the exploitation of a session token-generation mechanism or token security controls that enables an attacker to establish an unauthorized connection with a target server. The attacker guesses or steals a valid session ID (which identifies authenticated users) and uses it to establish a session with the server.

A tool designed to exploit a privilege escalation vulnerability in the sudo program on Unix-like systems. It takes advantage of a specific misconfiguration or flaw in sudo to gain elevated privileges on the system, essentially allowing a regular user to execute commands as the root user.
